Multiple articles in Tanzanian newspaper: Fahari Yetu and Tanzania Perspective, reported the claim that the Madagascan president accused the WHO of offering him $20 million to poison the remedy against Covid-19.
Screenshots of these articles were share: including Facebook, further spreading the claim.
The claims were also mentioned in French: 4. The Madagascan presidency, through Lova Ranoramoro, the director of the presidential office, categorically denied making any such allegations and stated that false words had been attributed to President Andry Rajoelina.
